washing_method: Soaked in methanol for 24 hours, extract discarded, fresh methanol added for another 24 hours to remove H2O solvates
Treated with dichloromethane similarly to remove methanol solvates
synthesis_conditions.drying_method: Dried under vacuum (< 10-3 torr) at 350°C overnight
sample_preparation_for_measurement: Dried again using the 'outgas' function of the surface area analyzer at 350 °C until the outgas rate was less than 2 mTorr/min (0.27 Pa/min)
A sample of 70 mg was used for N2 adsorption measurement, maintained at 77 K with liquid nitrogen
For hydrogen storage measurement, high-purity hydrogen (99.9995%) and a 75 mg sample were used

high_pressure_gas_adsorption_measurement.sample_preparation: Crystals of 1 were loaded into a sample holder under an argon atmosphere, evacuated under a pressure of less than 10-4 Torr at 350 °C for at least 24 hrs

neutron_diffraction_experiments.equipment: High Resolution Neutron Powder Diffractometer BT-1 at the NIST Center for Neutron Research (NCNR)
sample_preparation: Initial sample activation was performed in a quartz tube with a packless bellows valve attached, evacuated using a turbo pump (10-5 Torr) and heated to 350 °C with a ramp speed of ca. 1 °C per minute for 30 hrs
Sample was cooled, pulverized using an agate mortar and pestle, transferred to a cylindrical vanadium can equipped with a capillary gas line and a packless valve, and sealed with an indium O-ring
Sample was further degassed in situ for ca. 30 mins under high vacuum (8.5 × 10-7 to 7.5 × 10-6 Torr)
neutron_diffraction_experiments.deuterium_loading: A known amount of hydrogen (deuterium) gas was loaded into the sample (2.5753 grams), maintained at a temperature of 77 K until no pressure drop was observed for at least 1 min
